intro: Erythrostemon nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Erythrostemon nelsonii is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories.
